  • Method Details

    • getTransparency

      public double getTransparency()
      Description copied from interface: Material
      Returns the transparency coefficient of the material. This value determines how much light passes through the surface (0.0 for opaque, 1.0 for fully transparent).
      Specified by:
      getTransparency in interface Material
      Returns:
      The transparency value (0.0-1.0).

    • getReflectivity

      public double getReflectivity()
      Description copied from interface: Material
      Returns the reflectivity coefficient of the material. This value determines how much light is reflected by the surface (0.0 for no reflection, 1.0 for full reflection).
      Specified by:
      getReflectivity in interface Material
      Returns:
      The reflectivity value (0.0-1.0).

    • getIndexOfRefraction

      public double getIndexOfRefraction()
      Description copied from interface: Material
      Returns the index of refraction (IOR) of the material. This value is used for calculating refraction (transparency).
      Specified by:
      getIndexOfRefraction in interface Material
      Returns:
      The index of refraction (typically 1.0 for air, less than 1.0 for denser materials).

    • setObjectTransform

      public void setObjectTransform(Matrix4 tm)

    • getColorAt

      public Color getColorAt(Point3 point, Vector3 normal, Light light, Point3 viewerPoint)
      Description copied from interface: Material
      Calculates the final color at a given point on the surface, considering the material's properties and the light source.
      Specified by:
      getColorAt in interface Material
      Parameters:
      point - The point in 3D space (world coordinates) where the light hits.
      normal - The normal vector at the point (world coordinates).
      light - The single light source affecting this point.
      viewerPoint - The position of the viewer/camera.
      Returns:
      The color contribution from this specific light for the point.
